snippet: Sales at United States stores rose, but gasoline prices and the job market kept consumers from splurging.
abstract: Sales at Wal-Mart Stores open at least a year in the United States rise 2.2 percent in the fiscal second quarter, suggesting that shoppers remain stretched thin and wary about splurging; profit was $4.02 billion, or $1.18 a share; revenue was $114.3 billion, up 4.5 percent; Sears Holdings reports quarterly loss of $132 million, or $1.25 a share, compared with loss of $146 million in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 6.6 percent to $9.5 billion.
lead_paragraph: Sales at United States stores rose, but gasoline prices and the job market kept consumers from splurging.

headline.main: Sales at Wal-Mart, Though Still Rising, Suggest Wary Shoppers
headline.print_headline: Sales at Wal-Mart, Though Still Rising, Suggest Wary Shoppers
